oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Portrait of Hooks
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: African Americans; civil rights; Hooks, Benjamin L.; Shelby County Criminal Court; 1990s;
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: "Benjamin L. Hooks, with wife Frances, speaks Friday at the Criminal Justice Center. The portrait of Hooks will hang in Division 4 of Criminal Court, where Hooks presided as the state's first black judge from 1965 to 1968." (Clipping 3 of 3)
